course_description: Students will examine principles of First, Eighth, and Fourteenth Amendment jurisprudence through the lens of prisoners' rights litigation. Students will learn: basic principles and apply them to litigation using problem sets; procedural hurdles that incarcerated persons face in challenging conditions of confinement, including statutory exhaustion requirements, immunities, and other barriers to relief. This is an experiential learning course with opportunities for drafting legal documents, mock arguments, consideration of legal ethical issues, team case strategy sessions, and self-evaluation.
